Reviews.Title: “Vale a pena!!! Worth the price...”
Reviews.Author: dtdurand
Reviews.Content: Quando chegamos, minha namorada se assustou porque a faixada não é das mais bonitas, na verdade parece um hotel de beira de estrada porém quando entramos no quarto tudo mudou. O quarto era muito limpo e arrumado, apesar de pequeno. Boa internet e uma televisão muito bacana também são atrativos. Fui muito bem tratado pelo dono e sua esposa que inclusive me deixou imprimir os ingressos do jogo que tinha comprado na internet. Valeu a pena e voltaria se voltasse pra LA. When we get there my girfriend's first impression was not good. But once we got into the room everything changed because the room was very clean and charming. TV and internet were great. Owner and his wife were very friendly. I'd stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like this”
Reviews.Author: 7TroopCutCopyPaste
Reviews.Content: For the life of me I can't work out how this is rated so highly - I thought stat-padding but there are LOTS of reviews. My experience was less that satisfactory. You get a bag of goodies when you check-in but its nothing special, a can or two of disgusting vegetable juice and some unhealthy snack-size chips like Dorito's. Jerry wasn't particularly welcoming or 'hostly' when we turned up. The room was sparse and dated and not very big. The bathroom was cramped and shower wasn't great. The bed was uncomfortable and very hot - I think there were blankets between the sheet and mattress. The sheets didn't fit the bed and kept coming off in the night. There were maintenance workers in the morning that made a racket and we couldn't sleep in. The immediate location was nothing special apart from its driving proximity to Hollywood etc. Overall, the experience was poor and I wouldn't ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Briver323
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times I've had to do big video editing projects in the downtown area. So instead of driving home at 4am and being back at work at 8am, my co-worker and I stay here just a few blocks away. I knew it was cheap, but I was really not expecting the staff to be so friendly at check in. I even forgot my iphone charger at home and they were nice enough to let me borrow one. Word to the wise though, this is an older building (but clean) with small rooms, so if you aren't in need of something fancy and don't want to pay that much in the area, this is a great choice if you're looking for a clean place to stay. 5 stars for it's price, convenience, proximity to downtown, and definitely the friendliness!

Reviews.Title: “incredibly hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Emma D
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (both 18 at the time) stayed here last summer when we were travelling. As we were too young to hire a car Jerry was fantastic at helping us with bus routes and even drove us to the greyhound bus station when we left (free of charge). The motel itself is in a great location, very close to transport links to all over L.A. However, the area didn't seem very safe at night, but this wasn't much of a problem. Big TV in the room with loads of channels to keep us entertained in the evenings. Couldn't recommend enough, Jerry is a lovely man & the motel was fab!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Carl C
Reviews.Content: Jerry's was very affordable and Jerry is a great host. The room was very clean and the parking was free. We highly recommend Jerry's and if we return to LA we will also return to Jerry's Motel.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: PurpleGrrl
Reviews.Content: This place wasn't fabulous but it wasn't horrible either. I stayed here for a conference and it was the same price as a hostel/hotel within the downtown core. I wish I stayed at the hostel/hotel because of the networking opportunities, but that's a personal choice and nothing related to the hotel. Pros: - Good value - Manager was kind enough to drive me to the convention center (LACC) on the first day because the DASH wasn't running yet. - Good location to downtown - DASH to LACC was only 3 blocks away (DASH is only $0.50/ride) - Flat screen TVs w/ DirectTV & HBO and free wi-fi (main reason why I chose to stay here vs, the hostel/hotel, where there's not in-room wi-fi, or tvs larger than my laptop screen) - Free in-room safe, locked using personal digital code or credit card Cons: - Outside facade looks like an hourly hotel where people go to get serviced... - No real office. Just a doorbell and a plexiglass screen w/ a small pass tray (like at a bank) while you stand at the front door. - While management was great the first day, never saw them after. Two examples: 1) Left key card in room one day and realized it right after I closed my room door. I walked down to the office and rang the bell, waited for 5 minutes and no one ever came. Was running late, so I called them later that day. I knew I was coming back to the motel late that night (midnight or 1am), so I called to tell them so and ask them to just slip the room key under the welcome mat so I wouldn't have to bother them later. Woman who answered said "Just come to the office; we're here all the time" and "Don't worry about coming late, we're night owls." Went to the "office" and rang the bell. Waited; no one came. Called the office, no one answered. 10 minutes later, I rang the bell again, waited a few minutes, the manager slipped my key through the "cash tray" and was grumbling (obviously I woke him up, even though I tried to avoid this through my previous phone call) 2) For check-out, went to the "office", rang the bell, and no one answered. Had to use an ad from the rack on the door (holds menus, ads for events near by etc.) to make an envelope to make sure my keycard didn't get lost as I put it in the mailbox. Also, the motel is pay upfront for your whole stay which could be a con for some people, but I didn't mind. I didn't have a car nor did I have time to see much touristy stuff, so I can't address those issues. So in sum, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Average Thrills”
Reviews.Author: traveldayne
Reviews.Content: After so much doubting about this place and googled its location and neighborhood on google map I've decided to give it a go for 4 nights. Because? Yes the price which is good for LA. I had to pay upfront for all nights and received a bag of snacks & water. I am not too sure about the neighborhood though but i am sure it's pretty safe . Jerry 's run by an Indian family. Yes Jerry the owner I guess is friendly and I hardly see any staff around as their office window/doors always closed. No! they do not call you up and bring you breakfast or offer you coffee. Unlike other motels we've been to during our travel they provided you coffee and muffins. The office which is half covered by tainted glass mirror .You will need to press the doorbell and they 'll open the half door . Not very welcoming. Why they do that way is because probably for safety reasons. Well again this is LA motel after all. At night it can be really quiet there. Surprisingly it is actually located near business district ( about 5 mins drive) and a few blocks from a hospital. So I think the neighborhood should be safe enough.You will encounter police / ambulance sirens at the wee hours of the morning. We stayed in motels during our travels in California and I must say this one was a little disappointing. This could be the factors : 1. the room #6 were given located at a "quieter" side of the building was dated . You may also refer to the photos provided by other reviewers. 2..Once I came back to my room early evening and discovered the window were opened. Must be the cleaning lady forgotten to closed it back. Since our room location at the very end with high fences/gates and it's very private so no one can get in. Thank god nothing was stolen But again this should not be happening. I did not report this to the owner as we had to leave very early the next day. No doubt Jerry's is a small, old-fashioned-looking motel and needs a good facelift. However they have all the basics that you need of course if you are not too picky : 1.Good clean shower 2. Safety box 3.Wifi ( not the best connection but ok) 4.Flat Screen Tv 5.Free Parking The beds are OK..not the best but OK. I'm surprised my travel partner slept quite well that night. Maybe it was because he was very tired driving around the whole day! If I would come back and stay again ? Nope. I am pretty sure there are plenty motels around LA with the same price list? Shop around , you might get a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hosts and value”
Reviews.Author: AussieJohn101
Reviews.Content: Family run basic motel close to downtown LA. Only stayed 2 nights but would be happy to stay there again. Great matress, clean room and very friendly and helpful hosts. Short walk to bus. Try a trip to the farmers market about 4 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly place”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMama56
Reviews.Content: We needed a place convenient to Union Station for a short one-night stay. The hotel was exactly as expected, but we had not expected such a friendly welcome. When my husband asked about a convenience store for some late night snacks, the owner instead brought us a gift bag of treats, plenty for the two of us. He also called a cab for us in the morning and waited with us and our luggage. Everything was perfect for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Downtown LA.”
Reviews.Author: pajohns6
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Great location for access to Downtown LA. Jerry is am excellent host and went out of his way to help us. Clean rooms and free parking. Very good.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in its class in Downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: B W
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, there is DirecTV in HD on a flatscreen on the wall, and the area is relatively quiet. For about $85 per night, taxes included, it is very difficult to find better accomodations in Downtown L.A. The owners are very nice people, so it felt good to support his motel rather than some chain. If you can afford to pay $120+ per night, then certainly there are other more pleasing hotels to choose from, but for the under-$100 class, Jerry's was by far the best I found during my stay. It can sometimes be difficult to book a room at Jerry's last-minute because it is a small motel and fairly popular, so plan ahead if possible.

Reviews.Title: “The reality is ...”
Reviews.Author: staycation79
Reviews.Content: We decided to come here after reading the reviews on this motel and looking at the rather slick website. Furthermore, it's got to be good to be ranked 8th amongst all the hotels in Los Angeles, right? However, after a wonderful trip to Vegas at a cheaper-priced resort at a more convenient location, we were unsure how to make a true comparison. On the bright side of things:The location was good with Universal Studios a freeway away, the reservation service was prompt and no fuss, the free parking / free wifi / flat-screen HD TV with multiple channels rocked. Though small, the room came complete with all the facilities of a standard motel room. When you check in, Jerry gives you a small bag with snacks and drinks (all my favourites!). The water pressure and pillows were quite satisfactory. On the other hand: There isn't an elevator in the motel so if you bring heavy luggage, you'll have to get it up the stairs. The walls and floors feel flimsy as we could hear/feel our next door neighbours moving about their room. The motel is located near a hospital so we were awoken by sirens through the night. It is also located in between two taller buildings so the area feels hemmed in. The toilet is a little cramped and there isn't any light in the shower area so you either bathe in semi-darkness or wet the bathroom because you leave the shower curtain open to let the light in. There isn't a heater in the toilet as well, so if you shower too late, you can get quite cold during the winter months. The verdict: Considering the other hotels in the nearby vicinity were very much more expensive than Jerry's, I would say that Jerry's Motel is a good place to stay if 1) you're on a budget 2) only concerned if you have a place to sleep (and can sleep through loud noises). We saw the owner every morning about his chores and was always nice and polite but wasn't particularly very warm or friendly as the other reviewers mentioned. In the end, we're confused. We don't like giving bad reviews but we have to say, Jerry's Motel was an "experience" of a lifetime. Would we come back? Not likely. If you do decide to stay at Jerry's Motel, go in with an open mind and if you can survive the first night, it gets more bearable each night you stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay :)”
Reviews.Author: Rachel T
Reviews.Content: Me & my husband stay at Jerry's Motel for 2nights before we head to Anaheim, on First Arrival, Jerry gave u a Goodie Bag to Welcome us filled with Bottled Water, Snacks like Muesli Bar. He provide us Maps as well of places around L.A, will go back again if we got a chance in the Future.. Gor People who have trouble going up the stairs as there is no lift, request a room on the lower level. Good Value for Money as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in downtown LA!”
Reviews.Author: Luke S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Jerry's for five nights. It is in a great location to check out what LA has to offer. Although the motel rooms are basic, they are kept very clean. My bed was very comfortable, there are plenty of TV channels, free Wi-Fi, and free parking right at my door. Jerry was very helpful, far beyond what I have experienced in large and expensive chain motels.

Reviews.Title: “EASY walk downtown”
Reviews.Author: footloose55
Reviews.Content: We were in LA to attend concerts in which our daughter was performing at Disney Hall and The Colburn School (a music school kitty corner to the Hall). Jerry's was perfect for us. Except for one time when the rain was pouring down, we left our car at the motel and walked over. As anyone can see from photos and other reviews, this is a small, old-fashioned-looking motel, but I agree with other positive statements about cleanliness and comfort. In fact, that bed at Jerry's was a lot easier on my back than beds at many higher-end places. Good shower, too. And the price, needless to say, can't be beat: we paid more for four Disney Hall tickets than we did for four nights at Jerry's!! I'm taking my rating up to full marks for the value. Oh wait, one more thing: the goody bag at check-in (snacks and drinks): how sweet is that?

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive/convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: enjoyretirement
Reviews.Content: I booked this motel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor for one night, wanting to visit the Original Farmers' Market and the Grove. As everyone says, it is an old motel, but it is as clean as it possibly can be. We arrived early and we were given a different room just to allow us to check in and go about our roaming. On check-in, we were given a bag of goodies - water bottles and snacks. If your desire is to visit the Market, the location is great. The bus is just across the street and it is a straight ride to the Market. This has nothing to do with the motel, but the people riding the buses were wonderful - men and youths gave up seats to seniors and pregnant ladies, everyone was extremely polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great, affordable motel, close to downtown! Great owners”
Reviews.Author: PaulG79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Jerry's on my arrival in LA for three nights. Arrived early and was able to check in straight away, Jerry let me sit in another room until he had finished cleaning a non smoking room for me. After settling in was about to head downtown to organize data for my iPad, Jerry was getting in his car and offered me a lift, great as I had no idea where to go! Finally on the morning of my departure I had my room door opened as I packed up, just as I was organizing a cab, Jerry knocked on the door and offered me a lift to Union Station to catch my bus. Like I said, great owners, highly recommended for the budget conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: chrisb0707
Reviews.Content: Picked this place for the location and price. The staff is nice and if your looking for a place to just sleep then it's ok. Negatives - I'm 6ft and the shower head was below my shoulders, need more places for things in the shower maybe a shelf, and a purple spot on one of the pillows which we still don't know what it was.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a good motel near Downtown, then you should give it a try.”
Reviews.Author: kumaja
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night after our arrival at LAX. Due to the great location near Downtown we were able to explore LA on the same day without wasting much time. The motel has a rustic charme, but it's clean and functional. Free parking and free wifi is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place near downtown LA.”
Reviews.Author: MCharlie71
Reviews.Content: Had a 6 nights stay in early March 2012 and the motel is in an excellent place to start exploring the city on public transportation. From LAX to the Motel I used the Metro+15 minutes walking. There is a bus on the corner that will take you to Beverly Hills and a block away another one to Santa Monica. Metro red line will take you to Hollywood, Universal Studios and it connects to the line that takes you to Pasadena. The Motel is simple and relaxed, yet very very quiet, with fridge and micro-wave. Very clean rooms and good wi-fi signal. Excellent bed and pillows. Also with a closet and a fully functional private bathroom. Price is excellent and it's a great deal considering the average prices in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, best service ever”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyFords
Reviews.Content: This is a 2 star motel....don't expect anything more and you will be pleasently surprised. Jerry was the best host ever offering a gift bag with bottled water and treats. He went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. Great location as far as freeways and LA sights. Motel is older, cleaning is family style, not professional but all was clean and I am picky with cleanliness. Bed was great although the room was small. Would definitely stay there again. Thanks Jerry for making our stay in Los Angeles affordable.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: bowlmole
Reviews.Content: clean, safe, very friendly. Close to downtown. Jerry was very accommodating & a great help with any questions or requests we had. Will be staying there on my next trip out west.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, super friendly service”
Reviews.Author: O W
Reviews.Content: We have spent 2 nights at Jerrys in September 2011. As in LA one needs a car anyway to go anywhere this Motel is perfectly positioned and easily accesible. Had no problems finding it in the late evening driving from the LA int. Airport. The rooms and showers are nice and clean, the equipment working. Very comfortable beds. We paid 75USD for a night/room which for location and compared to the state of the other American city motels is a great value. Jerry the host was very helpful and nice. Even provided us with some milk and flakes for breakfast as we did not have time to go shopping after our flight has landed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good motel & Great host”
Reviews.Author: Enrique C
Reviews.Content: Stayed with Jerry's for four days in late January 2012 on my way back to Australia and I was very pleased with my stay. Close to the freeway (110 & 10) Cable TV with lots of channels, king size bed, mini size fridge, microwave, free parking. The cleaning of the rooms is done by Jerry and his family as well so you can be confident that the room will be clean and nothing will go missing. Jerry even offered me to use his GPS for free. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet & a great host!”
Reviews.Author: ElleCoolio
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Jerry's one night in February and it's one of the last of it's kind; "mom and pop" spot that is clean, quiet and comfortable. We arrived rather late and Jerry was there himself to check us in. He was so accommodating and kind. He made sure our needs were met and with a smile. Should I stay in L.A. again, I will stay at Jerry's. Note: not for spa types!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect motel”
Reviews.Author: Petr_Petra
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at the start of our one month trip and returned here for another night before our departure. It is a very good option for stay after late arrival or early departure as the way to the airport doesn't take long time. The room is clean and comfortable. We really appreciated owner's hospitality. We arrived very late and they were waiting for us and were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what is promised, with a touch of humanity”
Reviews.Author: Abhilash25
Reviews.Content: The space, infrastructure etc is exactly what is promised - simple, clean and no frills. The location is nice too, just off downtown and well connected through busses. The owner, also the caretaker was a fantastic person, hospitable and helpful. He even drove us voluntarily to the downtown transport hub!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Sam M
Reviews.Content: I stumbled on this place looking for a place to stay for a business trip in Los Angeles, and I'm glad I did. The location is great if you need to make your way to downtown and pretty much a short drive to everything else. So it's a great home base to plan seeing more of LA if you want to cover the most ground possible. This works great for me since I travel a lot for business and try to squeeze in as much pleasure/site seeing as humanly possible. This is an older place, so don't expect the 4 season type amenities here. Nonetheless, the service is really friendly. Overall, a great place to stay if you're on a budget and really just need a place to sleep. I'll be back here the next time I'm down in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Rather Dreary”
Reviews.Author: Bigplate
Reviews.Content: This motel is very small and certainly not as expnsive as others nearby. The location was convenient for us and it's relatively quiet and clean, but the decor is dark and dreary. Feels dated.The bed would have been comfortable if the sheets and matrass pad had fit the bed properly. Jerry, the owner was very nice and frindly. It's a no frills place and you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “The friendly motel of days yonder, in the middle of LA!”
Reviews.Author: MaxTLV
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation after reading the reviews here. The place is easy to find, free to park, not new but well maintained. The owners are the main reason to stay here: super friendly, caring, offering to help. You won't get anything like that in the cheap chain hotels nearby. There are no restaurants adjacent, but it's a two minute taxi ride (5-6 bucks) to downtown and there you have plenty. Same price/distance to Walt Disney Concert Hall, which is what I had planned for that evening - cheaper than parking at the WDCH! I got a small package of various snacks when checking in, in lieu of a breakfast. The price is right, too. Will definitely be coming back if I'm in LA for another concert.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: dimbert82
Reviews.Content: A old and very well maintained place All was perfect! The attendants were very nice! Perfectly clean room, spotless. As a suggestion please include water in the vending machine

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heather C
Reviews.Content: Checked in late at night for a one night stay. Owner was super helpful even helping us figure out how long it would take to get there. Small hotel, maybe 10-11 rooms. Free parking, free wifi, good location, clean rooms, fresh flowers, huge tv, DVD player, take out menus...it's an older property so don't expect a super fancy room but they make up for it with these small touches and the super clean rooms. Would definitely stay here if in town again. Also, they have the same flat room rate year round- you have to love that they don't try to profit off holiday weekends of big events. They definitely know how to run a good business and encourage repeat customers. Loved our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Thomas1704
Reviews.Content: A warm welcome after a long flight with a fresh bottle of water in a clean and simple room. Location close to downtown. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “warm-hearted service”
Reviews.Author: mavisjipjip
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nites at Jerry's. they hv clean and tidy rooms, with safe, microwave and fridge. Jerry's indeed very nice and generous! he tried to help the visitors in town as much as he could. on the late nite we arrived with empty stomach, we asked jerry if there's any restaurant around. he even proposed to drive us to the nearest "subway"! on the other day, a friend asked if there's post office, he also drove us to the spot and told us about the transport and the way to go for the rest of day. and there's more... :) we were absolutely impressed with his kindness and friendliness. the location itself is at downtown, with convenient bus routes. it was a lovely and pleasant stay! we will definitely come back again if we're in LA in the future!

Reviews.Title: “4th report”
Reviews.Author: stelai_11
Reviews.Content: this place just keeps getting better.Stayed over thanksgiving this year and jerry did ask to put down that the prices will unfortunately have to rise again next year but this place is a real gem clean tidy tv's updated again jerry and wife could not help more even offered use of spare sat nav now planning for next year.Only small gripe was that one night there was a sports event that went on till 1 am but hey! thank you jerry.

Reviews.Title: “Best service!”
Reviews.Author: Ardenz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jerry's during our trip to LA in Nov 2011. We have a 2-year old toddler with us and the motel is well-suited for families - very secure. Its location is just right, easy access to most attractions in LA. We rented a car and the free parking was just fantastic. Rooms were cleaned every day and the facilities in-room (tv, heater etc.) were so much better than a four star hotel we stayed at prior to arriving in LA. When we misplaced our key-card to the room and had to wake Jerry up when we returned to our room late, he did so with not even the slightest gruntle. When we asked for the nearest shop to buy water for our baby, he gave us a gallon of distilled water for free! In fact, we were even given fruits upon check-in when Jerry's wife learnt that we had not had our lunch! Really impressive, personalized service from the heart - if we were to ever be in LA, our first choice will definitely be Jerry's Motel again!

Reviews.Title: “home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: firefox_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Being a single traveler, it was nice to have somewhere friendly to come home to. TV had hundreds of channels and was large. The place was clean and basic. Price was excellent. I was initially worried that the public transport was not good, as I didn't have a car. However, bus route 16 stopped right outside and came every 5-10min goes directly to Pershing Square train station (where you can catch red line train to hollywood and universal studios). Bus 16 also goes directly to The Grove/ Farmer's market where you can have delicious food and good shopping (although about 40min ride). Bus to santa monica was also easy to get. The area is bit dirty (eg street garbage) but I always felt safe, lots of kids around as next to a school. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here 3 times on our travels around the world in Aug 2010. Jerry the owner is very friendly and very welcoming. He offered us plenty of nice cold bottled water in the 40deg heat when we arrived. The room (asked for the same room each time) was nice and cosy, like old English style. Everything was available, nice hot shower, free wi-fi, free toiletries, and a great huge comfy bed. Jerry's will be the only place we will stay if visiting LA again. The motel is only 10-15min walk to Downtown LA....we had a great time...it's a real gem. Jerry even went out of his way to drive us to the airport. Great hospitality...

Reviews.Title: “It lives up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Los Angeles in August and she discovered reviews for Jerry's on Trip Advisor. We already had accomodations elsewhere, but were intrigued by the rave reviews and drove by for a look at the place. We decided we would give Jerry's a try the next time we were in LA...and did just that last weekend. Jerry's lived up to all of the superlatives we read on Trip Advisor. We knew what to expect...this is not a high-end hotel, just a clean, comfortable motel at an excellent price. Jerry's met these requirements: we wanted a very clean room, a comfortable bed, hot water, and a secure setting. Plus there's free parking and a central, convenient location. All for $75 per night. Jerry told us the price is going up to 80 or 85 next year. That will still be an excellent value. We will be back! You can see some of the LA sights near Jerry's I visited on my blog http://mikeshistoricbuildings.blogspot.com/

Reviews.Title: “basic, but great value”
Reviews.Author: Ben P
Reviews.Content: I was traveling Solo in LA for a few days an needed a convenient place to stay for a few days. Jerry's was basic but included everything I needed including a fridge and a microwave. Located about a 10 walk to parts of downtown it made the perfect location to explore other parts of LA. Great simple service and plenty of TV channels. for the price you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Jerry and his wife went out of their way to help us!”
Reviews.Author: Millabette
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic find. Great value for money and location. Will stay here again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “ok stay”
Reviews.Author: franky s
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 2 nights in mid Nov 2011, here is my review: - location = a little off the track, but since i rented a car...this was not an issue for me - quietness = very quiet during my stay, very good - cable tv = vast selection, very good - internet = a little unreliable, connection was on and off, can be improved - room = typical motel style/look, no bath tub, looked clean to me, good - bed = looked clean, very soft and comfortable for me, good - parking = limited slots (might be a problem during peak period) but free of charge, good - breakfast = did not receive any so not sure if it is included, anyway i always prefer to eat outside and try local food, so not an issue for me - price = 75usd/nite, not bad with the amenities that i had during my stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice for one night”
Reviews.Author: karenpStLouis
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for one night. The area seemed kinda iffy, but the motel was clean. Just the basic for one night. Not sure if I would spend more than one night. Not sure why the complaints about soft beds. We both had a good night sleep! Liked the free parking!

Reviews.Title: “Good Motel, quiet, cheap, and clean”
Reviews.Author: Ste S
Reviews.Content: this small motel looks a little bit old at the first glance. It's not refurbished, but it's cheap and clean . I slept well, the place is quiet. If you are looking for a cheap and good motel.....try it! I think it's a family owned business, and the receptionists are very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Room nice, location not so”
Reviews.Author: Emma Y
Reviews.Content: Room was nice, comfortable and clean. Area was fairly quiet. Booked because had free parking and wifi access. However not great for seeing LA, Hollywood etc. Be warned bed in our room was VERY VERY soft, thought it was a water bed for a moment it was that soft!

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: kellypiez
Reviews.Content: This place was OK, however, we got confused by the #4 rating in LA and assumed it meant the whole of the region - not just LA downtown. The place was clean and quite well priced for the area. The owner was nice and gave us a refund because we had to leave early. There was free parking and the bed was really comfortable. The shower head was amazing as well. I probably wouldn't stay here again and definitely wouldn't if I didn't have a car as the public transport system is hard to work out and definitely not advisable for nights.

Reviews.Title: “Bad communication”
Reviews.Author: zbosherow
Reviews.Content: I haven't actually stayed at this hotel because of their poor communication. I sent in my submission 3 times to get a room and never heard back from them. I called after a week and they informed me they had never received my submission and they were all booked. By now everything else is booked up. Horrible service, didn't even apologize.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: foucault76
Reviews.Content: The location is central, walking distance from downtown. Despite its central location it is very quiet. The rooms are clean and spacious. Serious wi-fi service and great tv-set. The owner is extremely fair, makes all its efforts to make your stay enjoyable and comfortable, from fixing everything that could eventually be wrong with internet or so on, to finding you the best solution for dinner. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great central location.”
Reviews.Author: Joe J
Reviews.Content: We were looking some something cheap, clean and well rated. Well, we found it. This place is great. Very cetrally located which was awesome and the rooms were very clean. There is a safe in the room which was great. All in all, I will definitely stay here again! Don't be scared by the location, it's LA not Beverly Hills!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, slightly rough location.”
Reviews.Author: glvs
Reviews.Content: The motel itself was clean and cheap with free parking, flat screen, safe, free wifi microwave and fridge. The location is convenient. Easy to find and get places from (downtown, santa monica, hollywood etc). The area however is a bit run down and I would not walk around after dark. That said I think that's true of a lot of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel and location”
Reviews.Author: Maxime O
Reviews.Content: We went to Jerry's Motel for 3 days to visit LA and it was great. The room was clean, bed was comfortable and the price was affordable. The location is great if you intend to go to an event in downtown LA. It is also pretty easy to get around, since Jerry's motel is near a metro station. The staff was also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service & Value”
Reviews.Author: Jeff G
Reviews.Content: Jerry's wife and daughter were over-the-top friendly, helpful and accommodating (We only met Jerry at check-out, but I'm sure it runs in the family!) Jerry's Motel is clean, the beds are comfortable - and what a price! I was on a college visit trip with my daughter and she was equally impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Catching the Amtrak Train”
Reviews.Author: kanikani2
Reviews.Content: This was a very good motel. It was clean. Jerry was very nice and helpful. I was totally surprised to get such a clean comfortable motel at $75.00. I have never had such a comfortable bed and pillow in a motel before. Motels are nothing like hotels, so you can't expect the same amenities. I have often had unpleasant surprises in Motels, but the reviews convinced me to try Jerry's motel. They were correct. It is a good price for a clean comfortable room close to the train station. The motel has a microwave and refrigerator inside. There is a decent Mexican restaurant/pizza place just around the corner from the motel and two little stores with fruit, vegs, and other sundries. We ate at the restaurant then bought breakfast for the next day from the stores. I think we were nervous about the location because of reputation of LA. We had no problems. No one even looked at us meanly. What surprised me the most was the neighborhood was very quiet. We slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Very cheap Motel in LA!”
Reviews.Author: anthony1travel
Reviews.Content: Good place for stay any night... Near to LA Downtown and near little Korea... Very recommend for low price and fast checking. A typical Motel of crime films...

Reviews.Title: “Thank`s for the great service!”
Reviews.Author: AlutouS
Reviews.Content: Jerry and he´s wife were really friendly and helpfull. The room was clean and included everything needed. First we were skeptical about the location in downtown but there was no noises at night or anything disturbance. It was great value for the money. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: barclar
Reviews.Content: We booked Jerry's based on the trip advisor reviews and were very satisfied. The price was very reasonable, especially considering it's central location, and the room was very comfortable. Cable tv was a nice bonus and not offered in many of the pricier motels and hotels we stayed in around the country. Jerry himself was very friendly and it was a pleasure to chat to him about the cricket after 3 weeks in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Di S
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a wonderful stay at Jerry's - everyone was so kind and helpful and we loved the very convenient location. Fantastic value for money (how do they manage to squeeze everything in?). We had planned to stay there before we left US to round off our trip - but ran out of time. Would definitely return and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ga great find near downtown and Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: ediSusan
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay one night near Hollywood and downtown L.A. because I had tickets to concerts 2 nights in a row in the area. Being summer most places I've stayed before were too pricey, then I found Jerry's on Trip Advisor and figured I would give it a chance. Jerry immediately answered my bell when I arrived around 11pm and gave me a key to a first floor room which was right next to registration. Being a solo female I felt safe there, and I was surprised how quiet it was. Usually I travel with earplugs but had forgotten them and it was no problem. The bathroom is tiny and older, but it was adequate and clean. The room was clean and the AC worked great. There is a flat panel TV, and free parking is a big deal in L.A.! It was easy to find and easy to get around from there the next day, and there were beautiful purple morning glories all along the fence at the back of the parking lot. What a find!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Deanna T
Reviews.Content: We picked Jerry's motel based on the positive reviews from TripAdvisor and weren't disappointed. We only stayed one night but the place was lovely and Jerry was kind and helpful. All the positive reviews that have been posted are 100% correct. I will stay here again when I return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Integrity”
Reviews.Author: SojournerTruthFan
Reviews.Content: I concur with all the favorable comments, but want to add this story. We were there 6 nights and had two rooms. We left the tip for the entire time the morning we left. It was OK but not extravagant. They called and told me we had left that amount of money in the room. I told them that was the tip for both rooms for our stay. That kind of integrity and attitude typified our experience. Hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: 2difor
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we decided to give it a go as was so cheap. We were not disappointed. The bed was so comfortable we struggled to get up the huge flat screen TV had numerous channels my partner thought he was in heaven. Everything was spotless, location great for Downtown and easy access to motorway and Jerry was very friendly and welcoming. Don't judge a book by its cover. Will be returning when back in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great value IF you have your own transportation”
Reviews.Author: Protocolnine
Reviews.Content: Clean, very friendly motel in downtown LA and the price is great. After flying for 20 hours from Belgium to LA, we arrived at Jerry's by cab, dead tired and hungry. Jerry even offered us a ride to a local burger place. All tips were very helpful and he directed us the right way on the bus. The only donwside is the location. Being in downtown La you're pretty far away from most attractions and taxis will cost you aboutthe same as what you are saving. Buses are ok, but slow. So if you decide to stay here, just make sure you have your own transport as parking in LA is usually simple and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bellevidrio
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean, great parking no fee. Great Indian tea in the morning. Will stay here again for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: cyclone411
Reviews.Content: I was unable to find any better price on a downtown motel that looked OK. The Trip Advisor reviews convinced me to stay at Jerry's. This is a convenient location and the rooms are clean with comfortable beds and nice TV's. There are only 10 rooms and they take your honest word that you are going to show up - they don't have an online booking engine so you need to be patient and wait for the email that comes to confirm your reservation. Jerry's daughter checked us in and Jerry himself chatted with me as we were packing to leave. A very nice family and a very nice motel at an unbeatable price. You're not going to walk around the neighborhood at night but the motel itself is safe and secure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money comparing with other hotels i've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: CarFeg
Reviews.Content: i stayed twice at Jerry's Motel during my trip in California. when i arrived to LA i stayed 3 nights and before leaving the U.S i stayed also 3 nights. it's a family run motel, very friendly and very helpful people. I Thank once more Jerry's wife for not letting me buy a new suitcase, instead, she gave me one of her old ones to pack all the extra shopping i did. And Best of all "Free Parking". I strongly recommend Jerry's motel specially for those

Reviews.Title: “Love the place”
Reviews.Author: Wenni_Xu
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my bf for 2 nights. It's a very clean and well maintanenced place. Jerry and his wife were very helpful. Jerry showed us directions for gas, for food and attractions. Our room was beside the parcking log on the first floor, but I didn't hear any noise either from the parking lot or from the street. It's free parcking and the location is great. Minites drive from Japanese town (we love Japanese food). We didn't feel unsafe to live there at all. Flat screen TV with so many chanels.... My boyfriend had a great time at night by watching all his sports channels. Overall, great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for your Money”
Reviews.Author: Fuchsiapower
Reviews.Content: $75 a night....non-smoking rooms....free parking....in LA....talk about great value!!! We booked our reservation online and got an email confirmation shortly. Jerry was friendly and accommodating. Upon check-in, he handed us a couple of bottled water -- a welcome surprise after a long trip. The room we stayed in was dated but clean. The microwave and small fridge were a nice bonus. There wasn't adequate lighting in the shower area but it's not a deal breaker. It was not as noisy as I expected it to be. We were able to sleep well through the night. I deducted a star because they did not observe the "do not disturb" sign on the door :( I I know we didn't make the bed when we left in the morning, so I was surprised when the room was tidy when we returned in the evening. Maybe I should not be so ungrateful, but I had a bad experience in Cancun wherein i had items stolen from my hotel room, so I would have preferred it if my request for privacy be respected. Nonetheless, I am happy to report that Jerry's staff did NOT have sticky fingers :) I highly recommend Jerry's Motel to those traveling to LA in a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Don`t be fooled”
Reviews.Author: LBD32
Reviews.Content: The service and assistance at Jerry`s was fantastic,and the staff very friendly.They did their very best to help where ever they could.Don`t be put off by the look of the neighborhood or street view of the motel.The motel itself is not 5 star,but is clean,comfortable,and very affordable for this part of LA. It`s close to downtown via transit bus or cab.Access to the freeway system was also quite easy.Communication in relation to booking was very clear and simple.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Owners/ Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: vVVVW
Reviews.Content: It is what it promises to be - clean rooms with a flat screen TV and very helpful and wonderful owners. Very close to downtown LA and about 12 city blocks from LA Live.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for a value price.”
Reviews.Author: chrissy5775
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, decent location, good value. There was some music playing late at night from the apartments next door, but it didn't keep me up. The location is pretty close(@15 min. drive) to Hollywood blvd, downtown, & dodger stadium if there's no traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ctruong
Reviews.Content: The staff here was really friendly. They were really flexible with my check in time because I checked it really late. I would stay here again. There's free parking and free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: amd7785
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Jerry's Motel for one night in June 2011. All I was looking for was a place to sleep, and this certainly suited my purposes. Pros: Staff very friendly, room was clean/tidy, noise not so bad as others have said. Cons: Looks a bit scary from the outside, and there is no lobby - you ring a bell and the manager opens a half door to give you your key. However, there is a school right down the street so the neighborhood is fine. This is not a picturesque hotel or part of LA, but it is close to downtown and about a $12 cab ride from Union Station, which was what I needed. Would stay here again if I just needed a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “If we're back in LA, we're back at Jerry's...”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Munchkin
Reviews.Content: Great central location, free car parking, good room and friendly efficient service. Having flown into LAX, and been awake for way too long, this motel and the warm reception was more than welcome! Good sized room with everything you need, in location from which you can easily walk in to Downtown and beyond. Very easy ot find your way around the motel by car to all the main sights. (Would love to give 5 stars overall if it was comparisons against motels only, but it isn't a 5 star hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “The best-kept secret in L.A. lodging”
Reviews.Author: UglyShirts
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews from other TripAdvisor.com users, Jerry's was my first lodging choice during the time I'd be in L.A. (during the 2011 E3 Expo). But as of about a month before the expo, he was booked solid. So, I grumbled a bit, but made alternate plans for lodging at a pricier hotel farther away. Luckily, Jerry had a cancellation, and called me to tell me a room would be available not long before my trip. So, I cancelled my replacement booking, and made a reservation with Jerry. I'm glad I did! Everything the other reviewers say is true: My room was clean, charmingly-appointed and very comfortable. I particularly liked the seafoam-green bathroom tile, and the spacious walk-in closet. The TV had LOADS of channels, the Wi-Fi was free and worked well, and there was even a refrigerator and microwave. The room was so nice, I had friends who were also attending the Expo express frustration that their hotel was not only more expensive and farther away, but also not as well-appointed with amenities! As many others have also pointed out, Jerry is an incredibly nice man who is very knowledgeable about the area. He was able to let me know what buses I needed to take to get anywhere I needed to go as quickly and as cheaply as possible. In fact, he told me about a 35¢ shuttle to the Convention Center that stopped just two blocks away, and that dropped me off at the front door to the Expo in about 10 minutes! Add to this the fact that I was only a 10-minute walk from downtown. Really great location. I can't recommend Jerry's Motel highly enough to my fellow travelers. If you want a posh, black-tie, five-star experience, you're certainly welcome to pay through the nose for it at one of the chains. But if you're looking for clean, comfortable and friendly accommodations that are close to everything and for an EXTREMELY reasonable price, make sure you book with Jerry. He does business the old-fashioned way: Delivering quality and value with a handshake and a smile. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in LA”
Reviews.Author: Toada1
Reviews.Content: Yes this motel is in a convenient location. Also the owners are very friendly and helpful if you have any questions about the area. The rooms are clean. However, if you intend to sleep much at all, you should bring ear plugs as the noise from the next room as well as the street noise will keep you awake all night. I could hear the person snoring in the room next to mine. Overall, if you are on a budget it is probably fine for one or two nights. If you can afford more, spend it on a different hotel and skip one meal out to make up the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: 13whiterabbit
Reviews.Content: Jerry's motel was a cheap hotel in a decent location in LA - it's within 30min to most locations. It's pretty good for a short stay and the rooms are quite clean - whilst some reviews have something to say about the "dodgy" neighborhood - I didn't have any qualms about my stay there. The shower is spacey and the walk-in wardrobe was handy for our suitcases. We were also allowed to check in really early (9am) which was great after a long flight. Some cons include the fact that the bed was quite lumpy and the curb to the hotel was quite high - so just be wary if you're driving a car with a low profile. There is also wireless available - it's not the fastest but it's useful for checking emails and such

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: MatthewAndMaricarmen
Reviews.Content: We arrived at LA at the end of our west cost road trip, had picked Jerry's because of the reviews on tripadvisor and if was all true. Jerry was very friendly and provide us a great service. The room was very clean and location was good if you are doing tourism. We were really happy with our choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good Motel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: dangerdanG
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at this motel and found it to be very clean and comfortable. Mr. & Mrs. Jerry are very nice and went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable. We arrived late afternoon and upon check in, Mr. Jerry gave us each a bottle of water. The following morning we were greeted by Mrs. Jerry as we were leaving for our day's outing. She introduced herself and told us to let her now if we needed anything special. The room is much the way they show it on their website. Jerry's Motel is conveniently located by the freeway and most of the attractions. We would not hesitate to stay here if we are ever in Los Angeles again. By the way, there are NO bedbugs at this motel. If you are looking for a clean and comfortable motel at a very reasonable rate with free parking, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “This motel has friendly, helpful owners and the location is convenient.”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripper01950
Reviews.Content: I arrived at LAX late at night and had never been in LA before so I was a little nervous about driving in the city, but I had no problem finding the motel. It's easy to find, right of the Harbor Freeway. When we arrived near midnight the owner's wife gave me a warm welcome, along with some bottled water and snacks. Unfortunately, we were given a room with one bed, but we needed two. Jerry quicky made a second room available for us (so we each had our own room) and only asked for a voluntary donation for the second room. The owners were also very helpful in recommending restaraunts and giving directions. The neighborhood was very working-class, but safe and quiet. The rates were very affordable and the central location made it easy to explore all parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Value of money , incredible hospitality and warm staff”
Reviews.Author: stozkoparan
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have stayed in Jerry's motel for 2 weeks. Great location in downtown LA close to department stores and shopping areas. Very friendly and warm family who are ready to make you feel home. Highly recommended to everyone. Many thanks to Jerry and Nila for their hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable room great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Graemegb
Reviews.Content: Good location close to city centre and union station where my train travel around the states was starting. Jerry's wife welcomed me with wonderful cooking smells eminating from her kitchen. She generously offered a serve of the pasta she was making. My room was very clean and comfortable. On checking out Jerry offered to drive me to the station. Wonderful hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a good location!”
Reviews.Author: Funintended
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was all you needed in a hotel in LA. A bed, hot shower (if you don't mind showering in the dark as the bathroom light is seperate from the shower) and good location, right in downtown LA. We did see some small roaches on the first night in the bathroom, but they seemed to dissapear after that. Rooms are serviced everyday as expected and Jerry is very helpful setting up wi-fi and explaining US road rules to an Australian. If you know well in advance you are visiting LA, definitely give Jerry's a try!

Reviews.Title: “Good motel, great location to discover L.A.”
Reviews.Author: JVA1978
Reviews.Content: I booked this Motel for me and my girlfriend based on the positive reviews I read on Tripadvisor. I must say, it was my first time in the US, and also my first time staying in a Motel, so I really can't compare with any other motels. The owners are indeed very friendly, and the motel is perfectly located to discover L.A. The rooms are clean, but not super-clean. Some items in the room, like the clock-radio had clearly a lot of dust on them. But the bed, and the bathroom were clean, and I guess this is the most important. The only really negative point I have is that if you stay in a room on the ground level, you can have some noise from your above neighbours. So if possible ask for a room on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Marcusdarnley
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I stayed at Jerry's while visiting USC. Can't rave enough about the place. Clean, comfortable, convenient. The family that runs the place are really nice folks, helpful with directions and suggestions (where to eat, etc.). It's downtown, convenient to USC. Though it's some distance from the usual tourist attractions, it's near freeways. For 2 people there were 2 single beds, plenty of blankets and pillows. Can't beat the price. I highly recommend Jerry's.

Reviews.Title: “clean,good price, really gentle owner”
Reviews.Author: cocarlo
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a good prized room , clean and simple this is your place! Big pluses are the parking place and the extremely friendly owner.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but comfy with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: brookerie
Reviews.Content: Jerry and his family run a wonderful motel and will go out of their way to be sure your stay is comfortable. It's right in the busy city, but a quiet, smaller building with easy parking and a very well-maintained exterior. The rooms are small, but very comfortable and quiet, considering their location. The rooms are very clean and they work hard to provide everything you might need, including internet, good TV channels, and A/C. Although not intended for small children, they helped accommodate ours in the most patient, considerate, and remarkable fashion. While I'm sure it's not their normal practice, they brought milk and cereal for my exhausted toddlers, provided an extra small bed, and helped to be sure we knew how to travel where we were going. It is a small, older motel where the service and value are absolutely remarkable! Location very close to where my husband was attending a conference made it easy for him to walk!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Value - if your trip isn't about the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Taus26
Reviews.Content: Some people go on vacation to stay in a glamorous hotel. For others the hotel is a place to keep your stuff so you don't have to carry it around and to sleep and shower. My husband and I are usually the latter. I had to stay near Silver Lake area of LA for a business trip. Jerry is super nice, and more than willing to accommodate your request and to answer any questions. But don't be disillusioned - the place is not new, and it's not updated. At the time I went it was $65 per night. If you like authentic retro, and convenient location, this is your place. Everything the web site said was at the hotel (flat screen tv, cable, air conditioning, etc.) is there. Definitely bring your own shampoo and soap if you are particular. The bed was so-so (too soft and bouncy for my comfort) but clean, no bed bugs - in fact no bugs at all. Jerry had just shampooed all the carpets the day we got there so that was great. My only complaint? The Wi-Fi was spotty (I use a Macbook and iPhone). Not sure if I was too far from the router (as Jerry was having no problem with his computer), or if the problem was on my end - but that was a hinderance. The neighborhood seemed safe - the hotel is near a high school. I wouldn't walk around as a woman by myself at night - however I don't do that anywhere if I can help it. We rented a car, and other than our trip to Santa Monica and Venice, everything we wanted to do was 20-30 minutes away - no nightmare traffic either (off the freeway). I think the airport is roughly 30 minutes away by highway. There is a decent mexican restaurant within walking distance, and Wilshire Blvd and downtown LA are 3 blocks away. I would recommend this place to those looking for a good value - in a very central location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Motel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: diamond6Phoenix_AZ_
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Jerry's Motel to any person considering visiting Los Angeles. The motel is small with ample parking and a great location. You have access to the all major freeways within minutes. It is simple, quiet and very clean. The owners are very accommodating and knowledgeable. If I go to LA again I will stay there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for conveniently located, adequate lodging”
Reviews.Author: neilleucadian
Reviews.Content: Jerry's Motel was perfect for me. I needed a place to stay in downtown LA during a weekend seminar. I was able to walk to the Mark Taper Forum (20 minutes) and felt safe. The motel is older; the room was simple and comfortable, with TV, refrigerator and microwave, and comfortable bed. I appreciated the excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: kgs956
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Jerry's for one night. It was great for my short business trip to Downtown. The shady neighborhood put me on edge, but the guy at the desk assured me that my car wouldn't be broken into in the middle of the night and he was right - everything turned out fine. It's not the fanciest place, but I wouldn't expect that for $65 a night. ; )

Reviews.Title: “jerry's motel is a stellar deal and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: anita51766
Reviews.Content: i stayed at jerry's, b/c i did my research on-line, and it had the best reviews and best price for a hotel in the silver lake area. indeed, it delivered. it was cozy, clean, and jerry and his wife are lovely, hospitable people! i highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Value, hospitality, location, convenience, Jerry's got it all!”
Reviews.Author: CarbonMade
Reviews.Content: This is THE hotel for the serious traveler - the one that likes to be out and see the city and doesn't need all the prissy frills, spas and bars. First of all, I love the fact that the rates on the room were the same for every night- no different on Saturday than on Wednesday. When I arrived, Jerry gave me a bottle of water "for after traveling all day" he said, and answered all my questions. He explained where all the buses picked up in front of or near the hotel. This is a great spot for people who want to see the city but don't want to spend all the money for high priced hotels. The bus on the corner runs to the Farmer's Market, Trader Joe's, laundry mats, drug stores, etc. and also connects to other buses that go to Hollywood and Beverly Hills. Plus there is a mini fridge and microwave in the room so you can save a lot of money by getting groceries and keeping them in your room. The TV was pretty nice, with lots of channels for a hotel, and the rooms are off the street enough so you don't have too much noise to wake you up. If I ever go back to L.A. I will definitely stay at Jerry's! The only drawback I found was the room was a little dusty, but it was actually cleaner than most hotels I've stayed at that were more expensive, so I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive value”
Reviews.Author: jwbsf
Reviews.Content: We looked for a location near relatives for Thanksgiving, and based on that, looked at price, and then reviews for value. Jerry's scored high on all three, and we were very impressed with the cleanliness and friendliness. Word to the wise: Although they have in-room refrigerators, they don't supply coffeemakers, and we didn't see any coffeeshops nearby. I brought a small travel water heater, drip cone and coffee with cups, and did just fine for my morning brew. If you're looking for a good deal, everything else about the place makes it worth that one extra effort. Next time we need to be in that area of L.A., we will definitely choose Jerry's!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Jennibenni
Reviews.Content: Free parking! Great downtown location. Very friendly owners who are more then happy to help and provide maps. Basic room but clean. Great to have a fridge/microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and hospitality. I would rate 6 out of 5 stars if I could.”
Reviews.Author: VicJo11
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed here for 5 days 4 nights, we would like to share our wonderful experience we had at Jerry's. The motel is located quite conveniently from town, although bus switches are required to get to tourist sights, depending on which sight seeing places you wish to visit. In any case, most sights are mostly located away from most hotels. Otherwise, the overall experience in this motel is FANTASTIC. A 2-star lodging with a 5-star service. The bed is comfortable, the TV is huge that comes with many channels, and, importantly, the service is EXCELLET. Mrs Jerry, her son, and daugther, were all so helpful in making our stay there an forgetful one. Mrs Jerry is always checking on us if we need help, or additional stuffs, and even asked if we need any food during our arrival on the 1st night as we had arrived later in the evening than what was initially arranged. She even went out of the way to accompany us to a nearby shop to check on some bus pass rates, and directed us which bus stop to get onto. Her son even helped arrange and coordinate a shuttle to the airport for us. Her daughter also helped us with our food ordering when we had difficulty dialing in to the telephone codes. When have you come across a lodging service that is so hospitable and warmth, with almost practically the whole family involved? Here, at Jerry's, is the place. There may not be a bath tub in the toilet, or a giant live-in space, or fantastic panaromic window view, but hey, the service here beats all. My spouse and I will definitely come back, should we visit LA again. All the best wishes to you and your family. With Love, Vic & Aiping.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accommodation”
Reviews.Author: TravelBudz48
Reviews.Content: After much hotel/motel research we decided to book Jerry's. We did this by email, directly with the motel. I think we paid $65 per night which was just was we were looking for as we simply wanted a place to sleep that was clean, comfortable and in a decent location. For the price we paid in the Downtown location we didn't expect 5* luxury, but what we did get did us fine. Jerry's wasn't that far from the financial district of LA, and it seemed to be about 10-15mins from all the places we wanted to visit during our stay. Jerry's has its own car park which is included in the $65 per night cost. We stayed in one of the upstairs motel rooms. The room was fine - we had a comfortable bed, clean shower/toilet, small wardrobe, tv, and much needed aircon (we were there during a freak heat-wave at the end of Sept '10). The aircon was a little noisy, but it cooled the room adequately. I would recommend Jerry's as a good base in LA, it was perfect for our 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: ednastvincentmillay
Reviews.Content: We came in on long train trip. We spent two nights at Jerry's Motel. This is not 5 star fancy, but it is very comfortable and clean. The best part is Jerry himself , and his wife, Nila. They were so welcoming and helpful, going much out of their way to accommodate us. The motel is tucked back from the street so the city noise is minimal, in fact we slept like babies on a really comfortable mattress. The location is good, just an $8 cab ride from Union Station. Finally, at $65, the price is great on the budget. We strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal! What hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: coastlinevideo
Reviews.Content: I had to work two days at a trade show in downtown LA, and didn't feel like spending half my day's pay for a hotel. At $65.- Jerry's Motel seemed very inviting, and with all the great reviews here, I thought I'd give it a try. It's a small place - I almost drove past twice before spotting the sign. And I have to admit, being a woman traveling by myself, I did get a bit weirded out by the neighborhood at first - but decided after a closer look that yes, it seemed far from wealthy, but not dangerous. There were plenty of people walking the streets, Moms, kids, couples. No graffiti. Anyway, I checked in, and the hosts were so far beyond nice and accommodating, it was unbelievable. Jerry immediately offered to drive me to my conference hotel in the morning, so I could save on the parking fee. His wife did something that I am not going to share, other than that it went so far beyond her call of duty that I'm still in a state of disbelief. ;-) I had never imagined there could be such a small-town feeling in a place like LA. The room was nice and very clean - WAY different from the last place in that price range LA that I stayed in. No odd smells. Fresh paint in a cheerful color, and a comfy bed. Since the hotel is located half a block down Lucas Ave, the traffic noise from 6th Ave is not loud enough to be disturbing. I ended up exploring the neighborhood and got myself some wonderful fresh pastries from the Mexican market down on 6th. They cost me all but two bucks. Later I drove to nearby Chinatown for some more exotic flavors, and got a good night's rest for my work day ahead. Definitely would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Jerry's Motel - Clean, Quiet - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: D_B_TO
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at Jerry's Motel for 3 nights. It was perfect for us. The room was clean and bright, with a walk-in closet, safe, fridge, micowave, hi-speed internet access and a large flat screen tv with lots of channels. Great location with free parking. Jerry was a gracious host with pride of ownership. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price in Downtown LA and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: pilotgirl21
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is small and the neighborhood is so-so, it was a great place to stay if you aren't looking for extra frills. Basically, we were just looking for a place to sleep at night as we spent most of the day out taking in the sites, so at $65 a night in downtown LA, this was a good choice. The hotel was right in the middle of the sites we wanted to see, and it is located close to a major highway. The owner was great, and told us that if we needed anything, feel free to ask anytime. I was a little taken back by the neighborhood, but I had grown up on the south side of Chicago, so I could deal with it. I wasn't worried that my car would be stolen either. The rooms were a decent size, with a closet area to put your luggage in. The bathroom had only a shower (no bathtub), and it was kind of dark in there. The rooms were cleaned daily, along with the towels being replaced. The room also had a microfridge, which was great since we had brought along lunchmeat for quick (and cheap) meals and we didn't have to spend a ton of money on buying ice to keep it cold. We had problems getting the internet connection to work on the nights that the hotel was full, which is my only complaint. I would definitely stay here again when I return to LA in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice motel with very friendly owner”
Reviews.Author: hymerman
Reviews.Content: Jerry's Motel is pretty much your ordinary motel, elevated to excellence by the friendly and helpful staff, who made staying there a real pleasure. Jerry himself was so helpful to us, giving us directions and maps for everything we wanted to see. Getting around in LA is all about driving but we preferred to take public transport, which is evidently a bit awkward. But Jerry still helped - he spent time searching the Internet for us to find which combination of buses and metros would get us there. And when it turned out to be too awkward, he let us use his own satnav to find out way, which by the way is absolutely essential! Lastly, LA is where we finished our tour of California, and our flight back was in the evening, but Jerry let us leave our car at the motel until we needed to leave, despite limited parking and despite us checking out at 11am! The room itself was clean and well-equipped. The motel is tucked away around the corner from the main road so it's not as noisy as you'd expect from a city motel. Also it's pretty close to downtown, perhaps too far to be walking there and back several times but we did it a couple of times, and caught a bus from close by the rest of the time. Overall, we're very happy with Jerry and his motel. In fact, they're the reason I made an account on TripAdvisor in the first place - they deserve to have nice things written about them!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service, I recommend Jerry's Motel”
Reviews.Author: 255100Dave
Reviews.Content: My partner and our 8 year old daughter stayed at Jerrys Motel for 5 nights in late September 2010. The rooms were nice and clean and very comfortable. It was excellent value for money! Jerry was nice and very helpful and made us feel very welcome. In fact on the day we checked out, we were waiting for transport to our car rental,provided by the car rental company. After realising we had been waiting for over half an hour for our ride, Jerry called the car rental company for us and told them to hurry as we were out in the heat and gave s some water. After we had waited for over an hour, Jerry kindly got his friend to drive us to the car rental company. Thanks Jerry. I recommend Jerry's Motel to anyone who wants inexpensive accommodation close to Downtown LA, it is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place - a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: GoldenGategirl
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay one night during a huge international solar power conference at the LA Convention Center. Every hotel in and near downtown LA was booked solid by the time I was making my reservation and I didn't want to have to stay too far away and get stuck in the horrible LA traffic on my way to and from the convention center. It was a real challenge finding a place to stay - every hotel in my company's travel booking service was booked except three total fleabags, all with terrible reviews on the Web. Orbitz had nothing close by, there was just nothing available close by. Then I came across some positive reviews for Jerry's Motel, I contacted the motel and they had a room, so I reserved it. True to other reviews, Jerry's Motel is a nice, family-owned, clean, well-maintained and very affordable motel run by Jerry, who is a very gracious and accommodating host. I ended up checking in much later than I intially told him I would, and though i tried calling him to let him know I'd be late, my Blackberry wasn't working and it took me a while to get in touch with him. Jerry said no problem, he was holding a room for me (he doesn't take credit-card reservations, it's the honor system). Free parking, clean sheets and bathroom, nice flat-screen TV, off a busy street but very quiet nonetheless, A/C. When I'm traveling, especially for work, I don't need anything fancy, I just want a nice, quiet room where I can rest and work, and feel well rested when I emerge in the morning. Jerry's fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “$100 less per night than the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Bulatao
Reviews.Content: For a motel you get a really great deal. I was in town for a business convention and didn't feel like paying $170/night at the Westin so I found this place online. It was only a 10-15 minute walk (about 1/2 mile) from my convention and there's a corner store right next door. Jerry was very friendly with check in and everything. They clean up your bed while your gone and replace towels, which I didn't expect. Each room has a big tv and is pretty cozy. I will definitely come back when I have business in LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little motel close to Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: NanBou
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a trip to Los Angeles I stayed for 3 nights (Sept 4, 5 and 10) at Jerry's Motel. 1) Good Location You can either walk downtown or hop on the bus # 16 which will take you to the Pershing Square subway station. Also, it is about 5-10 minutes away (driving) from Union Station. There are no fancy restaurants closeby but there is a very nice and cheap taco place about a block or two down 3rd Avenue. 2) Good rooms The rooms are clean, fairly sized and air conditioned. There is also satellite TV 3) Great staff Very helpful, patient and professional staff. Jerry himself will drive you to the train station if it fits in his schedule. I would recommend this hotel for: - a short stay - someone looking for a fairly-priced, well located motel

Reviews.Title: “Great place, would recommend it to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Reklew07
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I drove to California to Texas and had intentions of staying with his grandmother once we got into LA. Unfortunately, by the time we arrive around 10 pm on a Friday night, she still had not returned our call, and we were left with no where to stay. After calling about 10 other hotels that were booked or way out of our price range, we finally found Jerry's Motel's number and called. We were able to get a room without having to leave a credit card number for a reservation, for $65 with no extra fees for taxes or having 2 adults, and they greeted us at the door when we arrived around 1130pm. They allowed us to extend our check-out time to 1230 instead of 11 the next morning when I explained that we were looking for apartments and needed to use the free Wifi for a little longer. Not only was she okay with us checking-out late with no extra fee, but also wrote down the numbers of several good apartment complexes in the area that were within our price range, as well as offering for us to stay for the whole week at a very discounted and generous price. This is a family run hotel, and they were a very nice family that did what they could to make our stay comfortable and pleasant, and I would recommend it to anyone. This place was far better than the 3 Motel 6s that we stayed in on our drive which were the same price.. but had extra fees for wifi, a second adult, a weekend reservation, late check-out, and requesting a non-smoking room, all accompanied with rude employees....

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Denellelone
Reviews.Content: As for me i went out most of time, and only come back to a nice sleep, i just need a clean room and standard facilities. This hotel offered me that, and i am happy with this choice. It also gives you free parking and plenty of chances to go to the town. If u want a 4-star or 5 star hotel such as Ritz or Hilton, then waste another couple hundred dollar, otherwise this hotel did the job for me. Definately recommend for budget travellers

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recomended!!”
Reviews.Author: teckwei86
Reviews.Content: Hi! I'm a tourist from Malaysia who plans to spend few nights in LA and guess what?! This is probably one of the best budget hotel I've ever stay. You probably don't get a bell boy to carry your stuff or limosine to the doorstep but the services provided by Jerry's family is far beyond expectation. Clean towels, bed sheets, drinking waters, plugs, fridge, flat screen TV, High-speed internet and more amenities will definitely not be problem for you. Travelling without own transportation? Is not a problem now since the location is strategic while they're able to provide details needed for public transport which makes your life much easier and cost efficient.Anyway, i would also like to thanks the whole family who treated me so good during the trip. If you guys really want a good room with affordable price, there are no way you're not staying in this motel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget motel”
Reviews.Author: Jcan09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Jerry's Motel for 3 nights in August. I was travelling alone and thought it was a great place to spend a few nights. I thought it was great that Jerry offered to pick me up downtown after dark - wonderful service. The motel is about a 5 minute drive to downtown, and there is a bus right around the corner that goes there. The motel was very clean and I was provided with a bottle of water and a piece of fruit everyday. :) Lots of tv channels and awesome air conditioning too. The price was very good and I would definitely stay there again if I'm ever back in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget Motel”
Reviews.Author: KellyandMike1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week while sightseeing around L/A. For $65 a night we can't complain! Jerry & his family are all very polite and helpfull. We bumped into them most days and they would ask how we were, where we had been & gave us lots of advise/directions. We hired a car for the week, Hollywood is 20mis away. Santa Monica - 30mins away. Free parking @ Jerrys - brill! Good size room & it was cleaned daily. Yes a little dated, but who cares for $65 a night in a good size, clean room! Fridge & microwave in the room.
