We felt safe in the area. Perfect for us as we were traveling on a budget. We would definately stay here again. Thanks Jerry!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Motel, and nice service.”
Reviews.Author: digg1
Reviews.Content: It is a very simple motel that had everything. The price was reasonable $65.00 per night. Very close to downtown, and the LA convention center. We need to place to stay while we attend the Anime Expo. This place was close enough so that we didn't have to mess with the traffic . It offered free parking, and free wifi internet which is hard to come by in downtown. I will be coming to Jerry's Motel for my conference in the future. Thanks for all the service, Henry

Reviews.Title: “True story -- Jerry knows customer service”
Reviews.Author: carlos99_10
Reviews.Content: True story: I made my plans for a business trip to Los Angeles about three weeks ago. Swayed by the positive reviews of Jerry's Motel here, I booked a room. Important note: Jerry (yes, there is a Jerry) does not ask for credit card information prior to arrival. Unconventional and while a little unnerving for some business travelers (who connect giving a CC# with locking in a reservation), it is, on the other hand, a fair gesture and one that conveys trust. Rest of story: Through a business contact I secure lodging closer to my business event (E3 at the LACC, the largest convention in Los Angeles), at no cost to me, so of course I choose to stay at that hotel. However, I forget to inform Jerry that I no longer need the previously reserved room at his motel. Fast forward to the first day of the event -- the day after I was to have checked in at Jerry's. I get a call on my cell phone and it is Jerry, who in the friendliest and an almost gentle manner, asks if I intend to stay at the hotel. I am shocked at my own forgetfulness. I feel terrible. I apologize to Jerry. I offer to make good on the reservation. Repeat apologies. Jerry will have none of it. He understands. He asks if I made it to Los Angeles safely. How my accommodations are. He says there is no need to send any money but to come by the motel to have a look and to please consider his operation on my next trip. Bottom line: Jerry is clearly a fair, honest, stand-up guy. I flaked on him and he never made me feel like the idiot I was. I certainly cost Jerry a couple hundred dollars in lost revenue during the biggest business week in Los Angeles. My hats off to you, sir. May the good reviews for Jerry's Motel continue -- you very likely deserve them. And I will definitely consider your motel on my next trip to LA. Thank you Jerry for your unconventional and unusually fair approach to business.

Reviews.Title: “Just great - recommended!”
Reviews.Author: OneofmanyMikes
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice - have no problem recommending it. What I need is a clean, comfortable room, big clean bed, nice bath, TV, free WiFi. Jerry's Motel had all those, plus very friendly, cooperative staff. And free parking!. Close to downtown! If you want a Hilton, and have an extra $200 to spare, go to the Hilton. if your needs are more modest, like mine, then stay in Jerry's. Michael IRELAND

Reviews.Title: “An excellent start to life in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: triptych42
Reviews.Content: As part of my relocation to Los Angeles I needed to find a new place to live. In the interim, I discovered Jerry's Motel and stayed there for a few days while I searched for housing. What a great experience! Conveniently located near downtown and most of the major freeways, I was able to use Jerry's as my home base until I secured a place of my own. The service is outstanding, the rooms are clean, and parking is included. The area is not what some would consider ideal but I liked it and never felt like my security was at risk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, friendly, and INEXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: Washington123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Jerry's for 4 nights in March and had a great experience. I was attending a conference downtown at the Westin, where rooms run over $200 per night. Jerry's was about at 10 minute walk away, and charged $65 per night. The staff, which is one family, was very friendly, and helped fix the wireless internet when it was broken. The rooms were very clean and very safe (though nothing too fancy). I ended up needing a receipt months later to get reimbursed for the stay, and they promptly emailed a copy of my receipt to me. For an inexpensive place to stay when visiting downtown, Jerry's is good option.

Reviews.Title: “Complement”
Reviews.Author: Raygm
Reviews.Content: If you are looking with competitive rates in LA downtown area, this is the one. The hotel's location is great and the service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great family and really make you comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JDMcK
Reviews.Content: We hopped of the plane at LAX, jumped in to our rental car and headed for Jerry's for 2 nights. Unfortunately I took a different turn and ended in some places that weren't so great and was feeling way out of place. Got back on track and found Jerry's, thank god for Jerry's!! Jerry and his family are lovely people and really made us feel safe and calm. The room contains your typical motel 1 queen bed, bar fridge, Flat Panel TV with HBO, desk, safe, air con, free WiFi, free park etc... (actually, now when I think of it, Jerry's really does provide the goods compared to other places). Jerry and his family were always happy to help, giving directions and advice on where to go. We would get a phone call each morning and Jerry or his wife would bring us breakfast (cereal, fruit, a botle of water and this very tasty Indian tea). Jerry's Motel is definitely a gem just outside of downtown LA. Perfect spot to get around LA easily, not far from the highways either if you need to get out of the city and see other sights. We'll definitely be heading back to Jerry's Motel when next in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and inexpensive, no AMEX”
Reviews.Author: BobM_Syr
Reviews.Content: Jerry's Motel is an inexpensive motel with some amenities as described on their website (wireless internet, iron, toiletries, microwave, fridge, flat screen DirecTV, etc). I didn't know they had breakfasts available for pickup until I read the Spanish review here. American Express isn't accepted, which I didn't know until I arrived. I paid cash for the first night and then went to an ATM for the rest. The owner was helpful in recommending nearby restaurants, and I found other restaurants and a laundromat (lavanderia) with my GPS. The motel is close to downtown, though the neighborhood was noisy at times (but not while I was sleeping). It took me 1/2 hour to get to some tourist sites like Hollywood, due to LA traffic and not knowing the best routes. At the motel, there were a few more guest rooms than parking spots, but the motel wasn't fully booked at the time, so I had no trouble parking. I stayed in room 8 and didn't have any bedbugs or other problems. The room was small but included a dresser, desk, and walk-in closet. There was no tub, and the shower lacked a showerhead, so the water just came out of a metal pipe. Overall, you could choose this motel if you don't need posh surroundings, and would like someplace inexpensive (and for me, clean) near downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: mrfrontrow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Jerry's 2 nights in Sept. The outside looks a litlle dated but, I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and neatness. The room appeared to have new carpet and a new beautiful flat screen TV with lots of channels. Linens were very clean and the bathroom was spotless with some new fixtures. Furthermore, the owner Jerry, gave me a free ride to downtown for business and was extremely pleasant and informative. A really great price considering how close to downtown it is and I will definitely stay again when I come to LA!

HotelInfo.Name: Jerry's Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 285 South Lucas Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90026
